oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rural areas; Country life; Oxen; Ox teams; Covered wagons; Bridges

Ganier, Albert Franklin, 1883-1973; York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture); Tennessee -- Social life and customs; Appalachians (People) -- Tennessee; Rural families -- Appalachian region; Oxen; Wagons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A man in overalls is pictured driving a covered wagon pulled by two oxen over a small wooden bridge.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oxen had served as a valuable beast of burden for Appalachian farmers since the 1700s. As settlers crossed the Appalachian Mountains into Tennessee and Kentucky, the oxen helped to pull wagons, log forests, draw plows, break up land, remove rocks and boulders, raise barns, pull all types of implements, and power water pumps and sorghum presses.
